Reviews.Title: “Run Away From this Place !!!”
Reviews.Author: Eric R
Reviews.Content: We had booked 2 double rooms for Easter weekend. Rooms are old, dusty, even dirty. A major disappointment for a Mercure class hotel. Staff at the reception is unfriendly. Easter Sunday morning, at 8.00AM, two cleaning ladies started to shout very loudly in the corridor - it lasted half an hour despite our remarks. Fair to say the breakfast is good, despite a lack of staff - anyway not very helpful (they do speak only German). We asked for a quiet room, arrived at 1PM (check-in starts at 3PM) but got a street room, very noisy. The hotel is not on Alexanderplatz, rather 400m away. We asked to park the car in the parking behind the hotel, but were told to leave the car in the street and put coins in the machine - while there was enough place empty in the parking. We will never come back to this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: JuhoH Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was huge, had a large window, wall-to-wall carpeting and a large balcony. There was a slight draft from the balcony door but I didn't mind. The sounds from the street were audible but I didn't mind them either. There where mugs, electric kettle, instant coffee and tea. Sheets were clean and were changed daily. Complimentary Wi-Fi worked most of the time. We also used the computers in the lobby to check some addresses. There was a chance to store luggage for 1 euro per locker, which was really useful both when we arrived before we could check in and when we checked out and had some hours to spend before our flight took off. Toilet and shower were clean and bright and had plenty of fresh towels. Biggest minus was that there was no way to lock the bathroom door. We didn't eat the hotel breakfast, but someone said it cost 18 euros, which is a lot considering you could buy croissants, bread and coffee next door for a few euros. The city is also full of a lot of great bakeries where breakfast with bread and coffee costs 4-5 euros. I should point out that this hotel is not really on Alexanderplatz, but rather one block away. The Alexanderplatz U-Bahn station was around 600 meters away. Trams went right by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Mercure Hotels generally offer good value for mone. The Mercure Alexanderplatz (formerly Agon) is a massive disappointment. The rooms are loud as it is on a major road and the soundproofing is not good. In the first room I was allocated, the socket above the desk did not function - it sparked when I put my plug in it. In the second room the refrigerator was so loud that I ended up pulling out the plug to stop the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, relatively old hotel”
Reviews.Author: AKB_Copenhagen
Reviews.Content: Had a nice and pleasant stay at Agon am Alexanderplatz. The hotel is good value for money, however, relatively old. We had a suite-size room and a balcony with views to the TV-tower. There is some noise from the busy intersection outside. Location is fantastic! 10 min. walk from the Alexanderplatz (where all types of public transportation is available) and a tram right outside the door. The breakfast is not impressive, but it will give you a good start to the day at 9 EUR. The service in the reception was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “rude staff”
Reviews.Author: moosenp
Reviews.Content: Staff gave me wrong direction to train station. Rude with every interaction. Hot rooms no AC. Location only good thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So Clean, kind people, good location. Huge rooms. Very good price-quality relationship.”
Reviews.Author: Ajpargentina Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. We had a very good experience there, breakfast is so complete and the staff so kind. Rooms are so big and include a kichenet, a mini living room and a enormous balcony. They don't have big beds but it's Perfectly possible to move the two smal and make a bigone. So clean!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: okataina Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a good 4 nights in this hotel. We have stayed here before and it will remain our base for whenever we are back in Berlin. Logistically good and close to some excellent sight seeing areas. The Brandenburg gate, plus some nice parks with fountains, architecture to look at etc. are all close, and plenty of shops and a couple of big malls near by. It also has an excellent breakfast selection and plenty of it. Staff also very helpful. I like this place and a reasonable price.We aslo had a massive room. Also very handy for the U and S Bahn and trains to the airport etc.

Reviews.Title: “central”
Reviews.Author: wearenot2old
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel that you can walk to a lot tourist spots this is great. As other reviewers have said it is basic, the rooms are old style but clean. There is no aircon, tea coffe making facilities or small fridge, there is a kitchenette but it is BYO everything. Breakfast was satisfactory with good service from staff. I was very hesitant before I arrived as it was booked by an agent in Denmark and I had read the reviews after it was booked but I would recommend it to the budget conscience the location is great. There is a few restaurants nearby just opposite there is a nice Thai restaurant and a German style just past the Thai As this time I was travelling by my self (female middle aged) at no time did I feel uncomfortable. Recommend the Berlin Welcome Card available from the train station, good value.

Reviews.Title: “a perfectly OK tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: loosegannet
Reviews.Content: Yes it is on a busy main road and yes there is no aircon However ...... the rooms are huge The shower-room is bang up to date The room was kept scrupulously tidy The breakfast is much as you would expect for an hotel of this kind but there was plenty of it and plenty variety The staff were friendly and helpful It is five minutes walk from Alexanderplatz It is inexpensive I noticed a few bad reviews on this site but we booked at the last moment for a long weekend and were perfectly satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: “Good centrally located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adityarele
Reviews.Content: The hotel was probably previously an old east German apartment block which was converted into a Hotel after the fall of the Berlin wall.Very good location and nice big rooms complete with a stove and sink and a small kitchen.Alexanderplatz is a 5 minute walk away.The one drawback is that the hotel room didn't have air-conditioning. Staff was friendly but maybe that was because I spoke fluent German with them. Good place to stay if you are 3-4 people looking for cheap accommodation in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Back to USSR”
Reviews.Author: persejonh
Reviews.Content: When I arrived to this hotel thought that I back to USSR. Room was big and clean but looked very old fashioned. In rooms kitchen I found many bottles from beer. Staff on reception was rude and not friendly. I came for breakfast at the end and it was poor.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: revitalIsrael
Reviews.Content: good location;nice hotel;the room was not clean,the geust before us left 20 bear bottels empty and it was there all the time we spent in the hotel,the were helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would happily return”
Reviews.Author: panzther Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I spent a stag weekend in Berlin and stayed at this hotel. The room was big and came with a kitchen sink and duel hot plate. I don't know if it worked as I didn't try it. The hotel was previously an apartment block and was converted into a hotel after the fall of the wall. The only thing I think they did was put a reception desk in it. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the buffet breakfast was very good. The night porter seemed a little put out that he had to let me into the hotel after I returned from a club at 5.30am. If I had to criticise the hotel it would be that they do not have a tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Wish I had stayed for longer so I could have seen the sights of Berlin and not just the pubs and clubs

Reviews.Title: “Ok, if you don't mind the views”
Reviews.Author: kuu-kanko
Reviews.Content: The hotel matched mostly my expectations for a 3-star hotel: bothe the room and bathroom were of decent size and clean. The breakfast was even better than average. The hotel is not quite at Alexanderplatz, but the trams run there frequently from just outside the hotel. Some of the buildings next to the hotel are in really shabby condition, so there's not much good to say about the views. It's a good place to stay, if you don't plan to spend much time at the hotel: the location is quite good and everything you need just for sleeping the nights is there. The lack of free wi-fi and depressing views would make me look for another hotel, if I would be on a trip where I plan to stay a lot in the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveTeesside Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel as it was recommended to us by some Danish friends who had stayed there before. I think it is an old apartment block, which has been converted into a hotel, our room was quite large, and it contained a kitchen area, but no utensils of any kind. The man on reception when we arrived was very helpful, but other staff during our stay were a bit more sombre, but all spoke good English Breakfast was good, and we can recommend the restaurant that is advertised in the hotel lift - we had dinner there four times. They have a small car park at the rear, charge is €9.90 per day, Wireless Internet access is expensive (€13.00 per day), but they have two computers in the lobby you can use for free. If you want a no frills tourist type hotel, that is close to the action then I can recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: scumhellfire
Reviews.Content: I really loved the hotel. The staff are very polite and helpful. Only bad thing is that wireless internet is unnecessarily expensive (20 € / per night). I find the room clean and comfortable. The breatfast is also great.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine”
Reviews.Author: DAM08
Reviews.Content: Got a great offer on 3 x twin rooms with breakfast so couldn’t turn down the deal for this Hotel. Besides that I’ve stayed in the AlexanderPlatz area before so (sort of) knew the area wanting to be close to the interesting areas within the old East. Arrived at the Hotel at 13:35 and, although we completed all the necessary documentation, were told we couldn’t have the room keys until check in time at 14:00! I’m guessing this is the rigid house rule regardless of the whether the rooms are ready and available or not. I also thought I read somewhere that it was a non smoking hotel however there were ashtrays in the rooms. I would have requested non smoking if I’d known as one of the rooms was quite smelly. Although the hotel was quite uninspiring to look at from the outside the rooms were large and airy with a balcony and a free room safe. Also had a kitchenette area but no kettle or cups (or coffee) - so take your own. Free internet access on 2 PCs in the lobby, plentiful breakfast buffet. The hotel was quite full but you couldn’t hear any noise from the corridors or adjacent rooms. I’m a great believer in you only get what you pay for so you shouldn’t expect 5 star facilities on 3 star prices. So overall, and despite it’s looks, my only real gripe was about the none existent kettle or cups (or coffee) - that would have been nice. The rest was more than fine for short breaks

Reviews.Title: “lets just say my friends and I called it the "Psycho" hotel”
Reviews.Author: heatherjoymc
Reviews.Content: I came here with my school for as part of a WWII tour of Europe and this being our first place of impression on Germany we were all a little freaked out. The area was super sketch, and I would not recommend to this anybody staying alone. Our experience started with a frightening looking receptionist, an elevator that took 4 times to make it work, a scary walk down the hallway, our room key not working an after getting it recharged. I mean we didn't really complain we thought it was all very amusing since we were in a large group, but seriously don't stay here alone it is seriously sketchy! Our friends refused to sleep in their own room and had to come join us in ours when they found the balcony door smashed and broken beer bottles all over the balcony, Good thing the rooms were huge! Then came the bathroom...oh my from now on we refer to it as the psycho bathroom. Everything is whitewash and we joked that it looked like a Nazi experimentation room, (we were visiting a concentration camp the next day) and there were creepy pipes coming out of the walls for no apparent purpose. The room smelled like smoke and was just flat out creepy. I felt bad for our other roomie who had to sleep in the adjacent room alone! The surrounding area was ghetto! There were obscene amounts of graffiti, rundown buildings, and terminated businesses. It was very communistic, like seriously nothing had changed since the Wall came down. WE later had to come back to the hotel at about 12 and if I hadn't of been with the group no way would I have walked around there alone. But we had a good time and now have many jokes about "the hotel with the psycho bathroom"

Reviews.Title: “Great value: a big room and a good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hillywilltravel Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said; this hotel is not exactly the last word in style, but it's more than adequate for a short stay. We arrived at midday, but the polite yet firm reception staff wouldn't allow us into our room until 2pm. We sensed this was more on principle than a matter of the room not being ready. The hotel is one block behind Alexanderplatz, on the corner of Otto Braun Strasse and Moellstrasse. If you leave Alexanderplatz by the correct exit, it will only take you 5 minutes to reach the hotel. There's a tramstop right outside. Our room was spacious. The bathroom was clean with a good powerful shower and fresh towels each day. The little kitchen area had no fridge, but we left our drinks out on the balcony for almost instant chilling (we stayed in January). We were not disturbed by any noise within the hotel and found the beds comfortable. The breakfast was fantastic on the first morning (a Saturday), and pretty good the other mornings, when there was a more limited choice. On the whole, for what we paid, we got very good value. You wouldn't want to go there for your honeymoon, but it is fine for a budget break.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly rooms, no service.”
Reviews.Author: beeci
Reviews.Content: Avoid if you can. Surely you can find other hotels for this price, and with more quality. The rooms were spacious but the preceding guest must have smoked so it was just stinking. The staff at the reception was okay but beyond that, there was no service at all.

Reviews.Title: “it was great value for money!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sergey_xxx
Reviews.Content: I had got a very good offer - 58 EUR for 2 night!!! But it was in Jan 2009, so don't be confused :) Anyway,it's great value for money!!! Room was Ok, but nothing special, instead of night view. There was kitchen, but wasn't equipment. BTW, hotel was old a little. Staff at front desk was adequate. Location was perfect: just 5 minutes walk to Alexanderplatz. Breakfast buffet was marvellous!! I can recommended this hotel if price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great breakfast, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: IWOM001
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my parents, requested a room with an extra single bed expecting a roll-out or something similar but was wonderfully surprised to find we had two bedrooms with a sitting area in each and a joint bathroom/wc. Plenty of room and privacy for all of us. The buffet breakfast is more that you could hope for - enough choices to suit everyone's diet and to set you up for the rest of the day. The staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is in a fantastic location making it very easy to get around and see everything you'd like to see. There's a tram or bus just out side that take you in various directions including to Alexanderplatz (which is also only roughly 10 mins walk away) where there are trains going to many locations + it's the stop for the airport express from Schonefeld airport so all very easy. We would all stay there again by choice - I can't imagine you'd find better value for money in any better location. For those who think this all sounds too good to be true - the only bad thing I could say is the lifts are really quite slow but that was really no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel location”
Reviews.Author: GoesAroundTheWorld
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel by a special offer. And for this money the hotel was perfect. It's located in the center. All transport methods is near here. The breakfast was excellent! There were plenty of food and everything was tasty. The view from the window on the Alexandr Plaz is amazing . About the room. The room was not so perfect as the rest. It has out-dated furniture. But it was clean. It has a place for cooking, but there weren't any dishes to cook anything (it was available by additional money). Perhaps It has more modern room, but I didn't see it. This hotel is intended for people who are interested in the hotel location rather than in room.

Reviews.Title: “The Agon(y) and the Ecstasy”
Reviews.Author: brit-oz-lin
Reviews.Content: We didn't plan to stay here, it was the only place we could find when stranded by Ryanair in the volcano crisis. I believe it's true, as earlier writers have said, that it's an ex-East Berlin block of flats - it certainly looks that way. But it was a haven to us and just what we needed for an enforced extended stay as the rooms were large and had a bit of a kitchen and a sitting area and even a balcony - perfect for drying the smalls. The breakfast buffet was not bad either. The only drawback, apart the ludicrously oversized pillows which had us in stitches, is that it is about 15 mins walk to Alexanderplatz and the station. This is minor though, as nearby is Unter den Linden and you can walk to fashionable Prenlauer Platz and ethnic Kreuzberg. There is also free internet in the foyer - one computer. There was also a very kind man in reception who went out of his way to help. All in all, reasonably comfortable 3*, in a fairly good location, and this would be a good choice if space is more important than luxury.

Reviews.Title: “this is a youth hostel - avoid”
Reviews.Author: mlillywh
Reviews.Content: this was not a pleasant hotel. it is a former east european block of flats and hasnt been refurbed since. Yuk. Oh and its a good long walk to Alexanderplatz

Reviews.Title: “A fine place at a good price”
Reviews.Author: 1stClassLounge
Reviews.Content: Definitely, this is not the Ritz but if your experience is anything like mine, you will be satisfied. The rooms are large and comfortable with a good shower and decent bed. This is my second stay here and both this time and the time before I found reception staff friendly to a usual standard (no effusive soliloquies as you leave, but I think you'll live). In fact, this time I forgot my UK-Euro power adaptor and reception staff kindly just gave me one from their box of random-junk-people-have-left-behind. Breakfast is European standard, lots of bread, cheese, boiled eggs, cold meats and juice from concentrate, fine to fill you up in the morning. If you have a kitchen in your room (and most of them do have kitchens) you pay 1.50 EUR a day for all the pots and pans. Beer at the bar downstairs is cheap and they will serve you all night. You are 5 mins walk from Alexanderplatz if you want to get out and about. If they had free wi-fi, I'd give them an excellent rating, but as it is it's 12 EUR for 24 hours, which is not the worst I've seen, I will only grumble about that a little. If you really object to paying for internet access, they have a computer in the reception area that is for guests to use. I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for reasonably priced comfort in central Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: nickster99
Reviews.Content: *Review by a 34yo Australian male" This hotel is nothing flash but it's a good comfortable hotel in a good location. The room is fairly basic, but who cares, if you're going to Berlin you'll be out and about most of the time. The bathroom is large with a powerful shower. My room had 2 single beds (I was travelling alone). The breakfast is very good - it's a buffet - cold meats, cheeses, scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, yoghurt, fruit, bread, tea and coffee. Very filling and tasty. The location is also very good. The nearest u-bahn and s-bahn stations are at Alexanderplatz, which is only about a 7-8 minute walk. Or you can get the 5 or 6 Tram from outside the hotel to Alexanderplatz (it's only 1 stop). There is wi-fi in the rooms at 13EUROS per 24 hours. Overall I think this is a good hotel if you are on a budget, or simply would prefer spending your money on something else.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: justlivefortheday
Reviews.Content: Good breakfast, very nice personnel. We booked a non-smoking room, but didn't get one, so there was ashtrays and the room smelled like cigarettes. The hotel is near the Alexanderplatz, so the services are near - there is bus stops and tram stops next to the hotel and the s-bahn-station and u-bahn-station are 0,5 km away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great sized room!”
Reviews.Author: Christopher0209
Reviews.Content: Good location. Not too far from ALEXANDERPLATZ. A litttle bit of a walk to the nearest metro (10-15 minutes) but plenty of trams stopping ouside. The hotel seems to be an ex-apartment block and the room was very big - bigger than my own flat. Kitchen facilities within one of the rooms. Very good breakfast selection available.

Reviews.Title: “council flats”
Reviews.Author: 050810a
Reviews.Content: i couldnt believe this hotel when my parents booked it. (i lived in Berlin, i went to find the hotel for them). its a converted block of council flats from East Germany and is literally on a 60s council estate! however it is central and the breakfast is yummy, the interior however just strikes you as something from only fools n horses.

Reviews.Title: “I would not even recommend this hotel to my worst enemy”
Reviews.Author: sldaane
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel and noticed a few dead bugs on the walls, but I didn't think too much of it. Overnight, I kept hearing buzzing in my ears as I tried to sleep, and my brother and I both woke up covered in mosquito bites! It was terrible having itchy red spots all over, including on our faces and necks. We made a point of keeping our windows closed from that point forward to prevent additional mosquitoes from coming in our room and killed probably about 150 mosquitoes that were already in our room. Before our second night there, we killed a few additional mosquitoes and sprayed ourselves with OFF insect repellant. We woke up with more bites. We complained to the front desk, but they just blew us off and said they know they have a mosquito problem and there wasn't anything they could do about it. If the hotel knows it's a problem, perhaps they should do something about it...invest in screens for the windows or air conditioning or fumigation...instead they did nothing and we walked around Berlin with red itchy bumps. Because we kept the windows closed to prevent additional mosquitoes, our room was really really uncomfortably hot. Overall our stay here was terrible!

Reviews.Title: “They should never have knocked down the Wall”
Reviews.Author: tubewayarmy2
Reviews.Content: Hotel was 10 minute walk from the Bahnhoff but locals had never heard of it. - Mainly because it's not actually on the Alexanderplatz. Felt very DDR in a cold grey kind of way. Our plane had been delayed, they'd been notified, but I don't think the receptionist was very happy we were late. She rattled on in very fast german despite knowing we were foreign. In the 7 days we were there I only saw her smile once. Food, cleanliness and service were adequate with nothing really standing out. Because of flight times we had to check-out in the early hours. We went to the reception, a lone guy looking at some papers or something, he just stood there, didn't even acknowledge we were there. When he was ready he checked our bill, no extras to pay, he didn't know what to say just muttered a goodbye. No did you have a nice stay? or safe journey home or anything. It was laughable.

Reviews.Title: “not bad hotel but not good also”
Reviews.Author: karamitsios
Reviews.Content: the spot is not the best ever. it is located into a very quite and at the nights frightening area.it is about a 700-1000m from the undergroud. the good news is that the undergroud station that is near, is alexanderplatz and you connecct with almost every line. regarding the room, was not as beautiful as i thought. it is below the beauty and style of the ibis hotels rooms. the old furniture makes it look not so goood, though the room and services are quiet good. the room i had was really big, with kitchen inside, seperate room for my clothing and a nice toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: brianp021
Reviews.Content: After reading all the remarks on here we often wonder what we are going to find, if at times you went by the comments people have made one would never book. We have found it is better to go with an open mind and make our own decisions on arrival. We do not believe companies like expedia would not use a hotel that was not clean or provide a reasonable service. In the end you pay for what you get. Now about the Agon what is peoples problem the ones that make bad remarks, the hotel was spotless. The room was clean and comfortable, reception was what I would expect from Germany as its more military than other countries. Reception staff were polite and did an efficient job, housekeeping were good the room was cleaned everyday and the towels were changes. There was no smell in the toilet which again was spotless with a good shower. Breakfast was exceelent and well stocked at all times the turn round on the tables was good unlike some British hotels we have stayed in. Its in a good location, the local station is Alexanderplatz which is about 10 minutes walk from the hotel, on the airport express train its just over 20 minutes to Alexanderplatz. Trams and buses run past the door and you can get anywhere in Berlin using the S or U Bhan a day ticket for zones A & B cost £6 GBP (6.10 Euro). Attractions are exspensive some as much as 20 Euro. There is a nice restaurant not far from the Agon very nice food and good steaks. There is a food happy hour on Wednesday evenings and Sunday afternoon where all food is half price. We were luck as the Happy hour was on all evening every evening. Anybody going for the Gay Scene this hotel is some distance away, there are three areas and there is a need to use the U or S Bhan to get to them. The scene is not like in the UK in main it does not start to open until the evening and most bars and clubs do not open until 10pm or later, its good if you are a night owl as it goes on then until 6am. There is no problem in recommending this hotel or with its location as the transport system is good. If anyone would like any further info please do not hesitate to contact us through this site

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable hotel - a little out of the way but close to bus and tram.”
Reviews.Author: alannalee
Reviews.Content: Huge comfortable double room. Cable TV, no mini bar/fridge. Clean, spacious and clean. Hot/cold buffet breakfast included in room rate. Just a bit of a walk to the train station and some sights. A supermarket is a 10 minute walk and the bus and tram are just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, plenty of room for a family”
Reviews.Author: Beer_Club_for_Men
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a renovated east German apartment; its configured as two rooms allowing the youngest member of our troop to go to bed at semi-reasonable time; the adults could entertain themselves thereafter. The Hotel is not going to provide you with a lot of amenities - but you don't need them; you're five minutes walk from the Alexanderplatz - you can get everything you need there. Its also a convenient location as a significant portion of the public transport system goes through the Alexanderplatz. Breakfast was ok, not great, but it fulfilled the requirement. The room and beds were clean and comfortable (I've been to France and Belgium often enough that I don't take it for granted any more). If I had to complain about something it would be German pillows - should have asked for an extra one for each of us - but they are typical German pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: john1cam
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights. Excellent value for money. room could not be faulted .breakfast best i have come across in years, travel problem free. highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel with delicious buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DomAnHerMadCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Agon alexanderplatz for two nights on a site seeing trip with our three children (10,7,5). It was perfect. We payed very little for our room through the internet and were given two very spacious rooms which were clean and had a kitchenette. The tram/bus stops right outside giving you very easy access to the centre of Berlin. YOu can be at Brandenburg gate in minutes and are close to restaurants on Alexanderplatz. Recommend the cocktail restaurant by the Cinema on Ratzpassage in Alexanderplatz and we found a fantastic curry house - a must for Brits stranded in central Germany with no curry!- called Aapla a 15 min tram ride away. Buffet breakfast was fabulous as good as significantly more expensive hotels. In all a great choice if you want a clean comfortable base for site seeing and somewhere with enough space that your kids dont drive you mad.

Reviews.Title: “great value, but basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: hvlloyd
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, our single rooms turned out to be spacious apartments so we had lots of space, unlimited breakfast, warm and reasonably central. all in all, very happy with the hotel for the price..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Scousetwirly
Reviews.Content: We got an amazing deal for this hotel through gta. This was our first time with gta and with this hotel and both exceeded all our expectations. We had a BIG room with a bathroom en suite, a small kithchen (you could hire pans and cutlery for 1 euro a day) and a walk-in wardrobe. Our balcony had a nice view over towards Alexanderplatz. The hotel is about 500 yards from the square. Everything was very clean and comfortable and we really appreciated the exceptionally good breakfast each morning. I had read some very negative reviews of the hotel and was a bit concerned about it. Having just returned from the hotel, I think there must be some strange people writing reviews on this website. We were SO pleased with the place. Perhaps some people dont understand that it is only 20 years since the wall came down in Berlin and they are still doing quite a bit of construction work around Alexanderplatz. But it is by far the best location nevertheless, because it is so ideally located for getting to almost anywhere in Berlin. Generally we found the Berliners to be very friendly people but I have to agree with those who say the staff in reception at the Agon are a little lukewarm about the welcome you get. Is this a hangover from the old East German days? I dont know but it didnt spoil our stay and we will certainly go to the Agon again next year if the price has not increased dramatically. I asked for a room at the back of the hotel (less noise from the traffic) and they obliged. They were efficient in the reception area, just not as friendly as most hotel staff we've come across. But in other areas of the hotel the staff were great. No doubt if we had paid ten times as much, we would have got a better hotel. But the Agon is very good and they have some great deals. They do not serve lunch or evening meals but there is a very good choice of places to eat at in and around Alexanderplatz. For cheap food try the station itself in the square and for veggie food we recommend the Hans Wurst cafe at Dunckerstrasse 2a, Prenzlauer Berg - free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel a taste of the old DDR maybe”
Reviews.Author: cardomon
Reviews.Content: Me and my son stayed here for one night as part of a party. The room was warm, twin beds comfortable, we were on the 5th floor and had a balcony over-looking a v busy crossroads, but great view of the TV tower. Somehow the room seemed dated yet everything appeared new ? CNN and MTV were the only non german TV channels. Breakfast was ok you can eat as much as you want. The hotel is in the old East Berlin so there is some building work going on. but it didn't disturb us. You are about 5 minutes walk from Alexanderplatz. This holds a major U and S bahn terminal. From there you can explore the whole of Berlin. I thought it was ok I wouldn't pay a fortune to stay there but it was alright.

Reviews.Title: “Big but basic”
Reviews.Author: Hutch1979
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and tidy, but on a very busy and noisey road. We had a kitchenette in our room which was useful. It's quite a walk to the s-bahn station, through a menacing subway.

Reviews.Title: “for two stars, and in former east berlin - an intereting hotel”
Reviews.Author: miehksa
Reviews.Content: for 2 stars, and in former east berlin this wasn't a bad hotel, and lively breakfast hall plus a central location. but it isn't a modern or stylish hotel, more like a retro almost soviet style experience. cheap and ok for sleeping, but not for hanging out more than necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Save up for one more star !!!!”
Reviews.Author: berlinbubbles
Reviews.Content: Saved up all year for my 14 yr old son and myself to have a relaxing, enjoyable break in Berlin, found this hotel on web but due to technical probs, ended up booking via travel agent. Arrived pretty late for our 4 night stay, because of flight delay. Noticed straight away that we were not made to feel welcome, just told where our room was and that breakfast was between 7-10,I put this down to me being tired and perhaps a little more 'sensitive' than I should be. It took us 5 mins to actually get into the room via key card as had no idea how to use it (No instructions given at desk!!) First impression of room...not to bad, quite spacious and looked clean. Opened bathroom door and stepped back from 'strange' smell, toilet had been used but not flushed...oversight by cleaners perhaps?? Room stuffy so opened window and was literally BLASTED by the noise from the extremely busy cross-roads right outside our window...'thank goodness I remembered my ear-plugs' I thought. Both fell into bed exhausted and tried to sleep...no chance for me I'm afraid, the traffic noise was just to great, even with plugs!! In the morning, breakfast turned out to be chaos with other guests stood with plates of food but nowhere to sit as not enough room. We stood and waited (being British we queued of course!!!) and eventually got a table. You are NOT allowed to help yourself to the cutlery so we had to wait for that. Food was adequate and you are able to eat as much of it as you like. I asked at the reception if a fan was available so that I could shut the window but this request met with a very hostile "NO, YOU ARE NOT TO HAVE ONE!!!!" So we returned to our stuffy, airless OR very noisy room. Other problems that cropped up was that we bought some cakes but they needed a fork , my son asked very politely at the reception to borrow 2 forks, guess what...we weren't allowed!!(Eating cakes using a plastic credit card is quite ingenious I think!!) I was plagued by mosquitoes and have ended up with 6 nasty, very inflamed bites which resulted me seeking medical advice about ( not from anyone at the hotel though, I hasten to add!!) Because of the mozzie problem, we ended up having to go through the night with the window shut in a room where the temp was 75 degrees(thermometer in room) so woke up with headaches, sweaty and feeling generally yuk!! I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone I liked. We both loved Berlin but our trip was definitely marred by the accommodation. I would have found somewhere else to stay if I had the funds but we had to put up with where we were...worst luck!! In short....If you are STILL temped to stay at this place: TAKE VERY GOOD EAR PLUGS. TAKE A PORTABLE FAN. ADEQUATE MOSQUITO REPELLANT " ANTI-HISTAMINE MEDICATION / CREAM DON'T EXPECT ANYTHING AND YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, balcony”
Reviews.Author: stromkr
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location for exploring Berlin, only a short walk to trams and subways. The rooms are big and clean, but a little worn down. Ours had a sofa as well as twin beds, closet and a desk. A big plus is the balcony, although ours overlooked a heavy trafficked street. Wi-Fi was available for 6 EUR for one hour and 18 EUR for 24 hours. Breakfast was included and was okay, nothing out of the ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a busy traveler that wants to explore Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Thalaki
Reviews.Content: (+) Good location if you are planning to stay in East Berlin and you are familiar with the scenery (kind of scary at night but still a safe neighbourhood) Big room, very clean bathroom, nice view from the 5th floor where i stayed kind of creepy guy at the reception at night but gentle Close to Alexanderplatz, 1 stop by tram or 5 min walk Tram stations to other locations outside the hotel Excellent, excellent breakfast, a very large buffet with variety of cold and hot food, really good (-) Very expensive for that kind of hotel, the weekend rate was almost 145 euros Bad smell from the carpet at the floor and our room

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: H0llyNZ
Reviews.Content: Awful. Located in the old East Berlin amongst abandoned and/or decrepit apartment buildings. No cafes or shops within safe walking distance. First room smelt of urine and cigarettes, asked to be moved to luke-warm reception. Was on the 8th floor, but very, very noisy. Felt unsafe, was so happy to check out and get to Hamburg!

Reviews.Title: “Save your Holiday”
Reviews.Author: lordzod01
Reviews.Content: I can begin by saying this trip was for 14 people paid in advance months befor and was a three day two night break. Upon arrival our details for our hotel accomadation had not been forwarded to the hotel so we were not expected, a fair mistake not the hotels fault. We were kept waiting as we were told we might not be able to stay, the hotel at this point was empty so what is the problem. The staff were extreamly rude and persisted in ignoring everything we asked untill we gave up and went to our rooms. First night On getting changed i went downstairs to meet the other people in our party. I went up to the bar / front desk were a german man sat doing some paperwork, pollightly asked for a drink only to be screamed at that he was trying to work (got no drink and went back to speak to my party). We left the hotel and went around berlin, on returning the security gaurd was so rude and in our faces that we were all left speachless. Morning Me and some ofthers make our way to the bar / front desk again this german man resides working. We ask again for a drink (which we are paying a lot of money for, and being a large group i mean a lot of money) only for him to stand up lean over the counter and scream the bar is closed and he doesn't have time for us. At this point i respond that we paid to be here and it is his job to serve us. We got our drinks and our change was thrown on the counter, my friend left picking it up off the floor. Second night We arrive in the lobby (by the stairs the lift was broke) to find a film crew shooting for the hotel and were told we could not leave or speak. We could not get a drink and had to wait 30 minutes to get out as the back door was locked to stop people wandering in during the filming. At arrival back to the hotel the doors were locked so we pressed the buzzer only to be confronted by the security gaurd screaming abuse in german because he didn't understand we were guests. not even an appology At this point without rambling on you can all see the pattern, this hotel has the worst customer service of any i have ever been to. The rest of the trip was good but how this filthy hotel was given 3 stars is beyond reason for all FOURTEEN people who stayed. Most hotels in europe if not all would see fourteen people as a goldmine. I must emphasize at this point that at no time was any member of our group rude or obnoxious back to these people, we found the experiance amusing at best A LIST OF THINGS NOT TO DO AT THIS HOTEL (LOL) Don't ask for a drink Don't ask for change Don't ask for directions Try not to go back when security is on Don't ask is there anything else for breackfast when you are presented with what they give you (very poor). Enough!!! My review ends with me honestly trying to help my fellow freinds on TA. Under no cecumstances stop here, the place is terrible and in my oppinion a hostel would be better than wasting your money on a somewhat dodgy three stars.

Reviews.Title: “if you don't like friendly service, stay here”
Reviews.Author: Dutchy996
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 8 people on a cultural visit to Berlin. The city itself has some very beautiful parts and we enjoyed our visit, but our lasting impression is that which was left by the hotel. On a previous review there was mention of the very rude lady at breakfast, we met her and know what you mean. Nasty looks and god help you if you want a knife to eat your bread with. Not all of the staff were rude, but those that weren't needed to be warmed up to be friendly. On asking for a taxi to the airport at the end of our stay we were told NO, they will be busy, walk and find one. 8 of us with cases and the nearest taxi rank 10 mins walk away. We then asked a different receptionist who called immediately and the taxi was there 10 mins after. The hotel was sold to us as 4* - it isn't, we got there and it was listed as 3*, so don't be fooled like we were. There are other hotels at similar pricing nearer the 'nicer' parts of the city than this one, and they are 4*. The rooms were OK, but agree the pillows are non existent, you daren't ask for another one, and there were NO facilities at the hotel to speak of. We asked for a coffee at the 'BAR' which is an extention of the reception desk with the reception person serving you and got two arms in the air and huff at such a request. Bear in mind there are no coffee making facilities in the room. However drinks can be brought from a dispensor on the 3rd and 6th floors via a VENDING MACHINE. We had one outside our room, nice. The main disappointment of this hotel is that there are no bars or restaurants close by, and we had to taxi to find anywhere decent to eat out of the depressing, opressive area we were in. You did not feel safe walking through the empty streets around this hotel. If they opened up the restaurant in the evening and had a proper bar it would make a huge difference to the hotel. Alexanderplatz is 5 mins walk away with shops but to get where the real life is in Berlin means travel. I have not written a review on a hotel before as not felt it necessary so I feel strongly that at the Agon Alexanderplatz, they are getting it very wrong. If booking - look at other options more on the West Side of Berlin. Where the room and corredors don't smell stale and the lifts don't smell of wee and there is life outside the hotel to relax at the end of a fantastic days sightseeing. Come on Agon - change your staff and get your act together, you're not in a nice place so you need to make up for it in other ways. Oh - and get rid of that woman at breakfast - she's going to kill your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ago to The Agon Alexanderplatz”
Reviews.Author: redsimon
Reviews.Content: Hotel Agon Am Alexanderplatz is NOT on Alexanderplatz - in spite of the name, and there is a difference. The first difference is location; this is not the elegance and liveliness of the main square of Alexanderplatz, but instead a slightly run-down district of former East Berlin still very much in its East German era, with little elegance or refurbishment. The second difference is PRICE, we paid 62 Euros a night (40quid in British) for a double-suite and I think that is FANTASTIC value. Incidentally "Lastminute.Com" wanted 62POUNDS for the same booking - do they think we British are too stupid to know the difference between a Euro and a Pound? The hotel is not elegant, but nor is is untidy or run-down. Our room was a suite comprising: an ante-room with warddrobes, shelves, mirror, space to put cases, prams, bicycles. A shower/toilet room (no bath, no bidet), with all plumbing fully working and kept clean everyday, and heated. Then through an inner door into the main room which was about 5metres x 5metres and comprised two generous single beds, a large desk/shelf on one wall with some drawers underneath, a lounge area with 2 chairs and table and wall-mounted TV (only the ghastly CNN as an English Language Channel). There was also a kitchenette with sink, twin hot rings, cupboards and shelves - everything to cook a meal, but no fridge, no pans, crockery or utensils. Then there was a full width balcony overlooking the noisy Mollstrasse - those Trams run ALL Night long! We kept our milk and food on the balcony as this was like a fridge in the December air. The room was generously heated, and we were able to control this. I cannot say if there was air-conditioning in the room, so summer occupation may be difficult Our room rate included buffet breakfast, and whilst this doesn't sound very hearty, in fact it was large. Hot Scrambled eggs and sausages, also hard-boiled eggs. Masses of cold meats, cheeses, salads, fruits, yoghurts, juices, teas, coffees, cereals, milks, cakes, breads ... We walked from the Alexanderplatz S-Bahn to this hotel, so its location was not a problem. Far easier is the Tram, the M6 stops outside the Hotel in Otto Braunstrasse, but the M4 and M5 trams also stop outside on Mollstrasse (2 stops frm S and U Alexanderplatz. On the north side of Otto Braunstrasse (diagonally across from the hotel) you can catch buses 100, 200, and TXL which will run to Brandenburger Tor and Unter Den Linden. So whilst the hotel is not located as well as its address suggests, in fact it is a good location and is a good price. For 62Euros I would give this 5stars, but in the context of all Berlin Hotels then it is a very good 3Stars.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad!”
Reviews.Author: NeenyP
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with my husband in mid October of this year. We had originally booked to stay at an AGON further out, on Frankfurter Allee, but when we got to that hotel they had double booked! we needn't have worried as we were immediately transported to this hotel by taxi (paid for by the hotel chain) and we were pleased with what we found. Staff were pleasant, rooms clean. Breakfast buffett style, and very nice. The room my husband and I got was like an apartment, with a small kitchen area and a balcony with a good view. Bathroom with shower, clean and easy to use! Hotel about 5/10 minutes walk from the Alexanderplatz. Would recommend going up the TV tower (but get there early, as the queues get rather long!) Also, would recommend a tour bus, which takes approx. 2 hours. Well worth doing! All in all, we liked this hotel, and could see no reason to complain!

Reviews.Title: “Try to avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: Emobiliare
Reviews.Content: We joined a tour group out of Singapore to Eastern Europe and our last stop was Berlin. Very very unfortunate for us that Park Inn was fully booked and the tour agent booked this hotel. Firstly the impression we got from the room was that it is not a hotel but looks more like a service apartment. THe room and hallway has a bad smell. the toilet to our disgust still had the remains of the previous guest!!! The front office staffs were very RUDE indeed towards our guide and us. They even lock us out of our room when we got back 1 hour late. Try to avoid this place if you can. We will certainly not go back there.

Reviews.Title: “ITEMS STOLEN FROM ROOM”
Reviews.Author: SchoeneReise
Reviews.Content: After checking out of the Agon am Alexanderplatz we discovered that our cell phone and IPod had both been stolen from the luggage in our hotel room. Please be warned,and be sure to store ALL valuables in the closet safe (not just passports,as we did).

Reviews.Title: “I had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: phibi
Reviews.Content: the hotel is near Alexander Platz, there is a bus stop just in front of the hotel which allows you to easily reach Alxender Platz if you r not in the mood to walk 5 minutes... from Alexander Platz u can take all kind of public transports that will allow u to reach all the parts of the city. The rooms were big enough, clean and very confortable, the people who work there are friendly. breakfast was very good. I really advice the hotel

Reviews.Title: “o.k. hotel, area not so great”
Reviews.Author: micmse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a busy intersection, next to the train station. Other than that it is about a 10 minute walk to any civilization. Almost everything around is boarded up and desserted. Not being familiar with the city, I was not comfortable walking from the hotel to attractions. It is definitly on the far side of town. Rooms were o.k., could use some updating.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this East German gem”
Reviews.Author: E_Pepys
Reviews.Content: Located right near Alexanderplatz, this ginormous, apartment building sized hotel fitted our needs perfectly. It is an example of your typical block-fashioned Mauer architecture, and that is part of its appeal. My sister and I got our own rooms at this hotel, and we found that your hotel room is plural! We each had a changing room, hallway, bathroom, and bedroom complete with a kitchenette and a balcony commanding spectacular views of the Fernsehturm with the airport in the distance. The staff was very helpful, and one of the big bonuses is the buffet breakfast! They say it is only "cold buffet", but they also serve hot scrambled eggs! It was a feast with all the different kinds of sliced meats, cheeses, rolls, and yogurt, hard-boiled eggs and cake slices. The only downside we found was that there was only one public computer to access your e-mail on (only a downside if you do not have your own laptop) and sometimes there was a long wait for it. But there are plenty of internet cafes in Berlin to make up for that. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Panoramic View”
Reviews.Author: localcolour
Reviews.Content: Five minutes' walk to Alexanderplatz with cafes, all transport, information, shops, post office. You can take the tram back if you're loaded with shopping. The hotel is on the corner of Mollstrasse and Otto-Bruan Strasse, both very wide roads, with tramlines. If you can't sleep for rumble of traffic noise, this is not the place for you. I, personally, had no problem. The room was on the 7th floor, with a superb view. The shower was excellent, the bed comfortable. No luxuries. Bring your own shower cap. There seems to be a shortage of clothes hangers. The cold breakfast was very good, with boiled egg, different kinds of bread, meats, pate, cheese, salad stuff, cereal, fruit salad, yoghourt and more. Coffee, assorted teas. Breakfast is from 7am to 10am, which is very flexible. There is internet use in the foyer. Lots of places of interest are within walking distance, but as someone on the plane warned us not to underestimate distances in Berlin, we used the excellent public transport system. Sybil

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: edpurs999
Reviews.Content: The criticism of this hotel is not really very fair. I hve stayed here three times, and tend to make this my base when I visit my favourite city. It is a budget hotel made from a converted appartment block. The rooms vary from generously sized to suites, and all I have seen also have a cooker and sink. It is about 5 minutes from Alexanderplatz, the centre of the old East Berlin,and in my opinion the best bit of Berlin. Because of its history Berlin has two centres, the shopping bit is in the old West Berlin, which is a short train ride away, so if you want shopping on your doorstep then that is the area to go to. This part of Berlin has most of the museums, great cheap eats, and the cathederal. The area around the hotel is a bit grimy but I have never seen any trouble there, and there is a lot of redevelopment of the Alexanderplatz area. As far as the airport is concerned, the TXL express bus stops almost outside of the hotel. Furthermore, it is right at the end of the route, so you can't go too far, and on the way back you are certain to get a seat. My advice, go there, enjoy the fact it is not in the main tourist area. Meet some Berliners, have a walk around, especially down Karl Marx Allee. it is such a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but flawed.”
Reviews.Author: colinrchorley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Agon Alexanderplatz for 3 nights for a long weekend break and the decision was primarily based on cost and the reviews listed here. Although some parts of the hotel are OK, there is too much against it to say this is a good hotel. We arrived in Berlin from Tegel airport which does not have its own train station, you have to get on a bus which will take you to a station on the U-Bahn so we ended up catching a taxi to the hotel instead which came to about 25 Euro's which is cheaper than most taxi's to other European cities we have been to. Initial impressions of the place are understandibly quite bad. Its right in the heart of the old East Berlin so every building in the area is communist in design, rectangular and not pretty and surrounded by busy main roads. Inside though is a bit better, checking in was quick but some of the staff behind reception need a few lessons in customer service (ie. a smile or even some acknowledgment when handing in keys wouldn't go amiss). We got a room on the first floor, used the 2 lifts initially which look more like detention cells, walked through the dark and very green hallway to our room. We had a south facing room which meant we were away from the main noise from the traffic and could see the main highrises around Alexanderplatz but did overlook some other grotty buildings. From then on we used the stairs coming to and from the room but in the evenings these are pitch black. The room in fairness was very spacious and included its own area for the wardrobe, a free to use safe, small table and chair in the middle of the floor (and a pretty stained floor at that) and a small kitchenette in the corner (although nothing is included to use with it so unless you bring your own pots, pans and cutlery I see little point in this being here). Bathroom is basic including a shower cubicle (complete with a large damp patch in the corner). The double room was in fact 2 twin beds so you will have to move them together but the covers only just fit the width of the single beds and the pillow is virtually non existent and even doubling up is not enough so sleeping for us was hard to achieve. There is also no air conditioning either and so the room can get quite warm especially in the evening. The room also has its own balcony which has not been cleaned for ages and still had traces of what used to shield the balcony along the side so could be quite dangerous as these are very sharp. Being on the first floor we could not leave the balcony door or window open as anyone could potentially climb in if they wanted to make an effort Breakfast was included in the price although nothing to shout home about, there were no hot breakfast options available, only a few cold meats, plenty of cereal and bread rolls and a handful of cake slices. My wife thought the breakfast was excellent though but hot breakfasts are more to my liking. The location I would say is well within walking distance to the majority of sites up to the Brandenburg Gate and Reichstag, beyond that you may want to choose the U-Bahn or S-Bahn instead, the nearest one being in Alexanderplatz some 5 minutes away. I would say one thing though, coming home when its dark to the hotel is quite off putting as its not very busy at all and very dark in places but there is a tram station round the corner. The trams though only serve the old East side. We paid just £149.75 for the 3 nights which is exceptionally cheap and therefore the review has to be put into that kind of perspective. If I were coming to Berlin again, I would probably find a hotel nearer the Brandenburg Gate so its more central to all sites and would be happy to pay a bit more but for those on a budget and do not mind relinquishing some comforts then this hotel is fine. Personally the fact that I had major trouble sleeping in the room is the largest factor to decide if a hotel is good or bad and in this case I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get stuck in the lift!!!”
Reviews.Author: RogerKent
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok I guess, however upon entering the lift on our way down to breakfast, the lift brokedown on us. To which we were stuck in for a whole hour!! An engineer finally arrived to save the day, (who couldn't speak a word of english by the way!), and we were out of the lift. However at this point, myself and my wife were both exhausted and as my wife suffers from claustaphobia, she was very shaken up and distressed. We all know faults can happen, and nobody was to blame, however it was the way the Hotel dealt with the situation which upset us the most. As we had been stuck in the lift for so long, not only did we miss our complimentary breakfast, but there was no appologies or anything, we were just given a line about ''the lift having nothing to do with the Hotel!'' and not only that, the staff at reception, who had miraculously stopped being able to speak English, didn't even realise we were in there! It ruined our day, and we will not be staying at this hotel again because of this incident.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the sights.”
Reviews.Author: gecko77
Reviews.Content: The hotel has smoking and non smoking rooms. The non smoking rooms being on the top couple of floors - so affording great views. The rooms are a good size. We had a little kitchenette in the corner of the room and a nice dressing area near the door where the wardrobe was. The hotel is convenient to Alexanderplatz and therefore the local transport system which is perfect for sightseeing. There is a computer you can use for free and a little bar. The breakfast was generous buffet style and very yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for seeing Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Nick H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a brilliant place to see the main sights of Berlin being so close to the transport hub of Alexanderplatz. Situated in a former East German block of flats the hotel is no stunner from the outside but inside it is bright and the rooms were airy, clean and comfortable. Ours had a small kitchen but no crockery or cutlery so it was a bit strange! The room had a balcony overlooking the intersection of Mollstraße and Otto-Braun Straße with Alexanderplatz in the distance, but it was not too noisy. The staff ranged from very friendly to a bit surly but the breakfast was always great and the staff regularly topped up the various things. Overall, it was a great hotel for a cheap stay in Berlin, which is an absolutely wonderful city and one I shall certainly return to!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Milo2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, the staff were very helpful & the location was brilliant. Although the rooms were quite basic, the location made it the ideal place to explore Berlin from.

Reviews.Title: “A great East German style base from which to explore Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ButtercupBento
Reviews.Content: If you are after a hotel that feels East German, this is it with it's exterior and painted concrete walls. It is on the corner of 2 busy roads but with the large patio doors to the balcony shut you only heard the occasional tram. From the balcony we had views towards the TV tower in Alexanderplatz. The location is great with only a 5 minute walk to Anlexanderplatz with it's train station. The room (303) was spacious and clean with a separate hallway with dressing area, large shower room/toilet, balcony, and in the main room, small kitchenette area, table and chairs, and two twin beds which we pushed together. There were a few spots on the carpet and the pillows were rather thin as others have mentioned. The breakfast was, as you would expect, a continental buffet breakfast and some of the items (especially the meats) were not of the highest quality, more your value type products, but it was plentiful and well stocked with hot runny boiled eggs. I would not recommend this hotel for a romantic break but for a base from which to explore Berlin you would be hard pushed to find anythin better in this price bracket and area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for short break”
Reviews.Author: Janemm7
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights with group of friends. the rooms were basic, but, very clean and large - there was even a small kitchen with 2 ring hob in the room. The breakfast was a good buffet with plenty of choice. The location was excellent for transport links to the rest of the city. the number 200 bus, from just outside the hotel took us nearly everywhere we wanted to go - from the East to the West along the main shopping and historic sites. Just buy a 2 or 3 day Welcome Card for unlimited travel on all forms of city transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great value fo rmoney - a real East Berlin experience”
Reviews.Author: calam1ty
Reviews.Content: I echo most of the other reviews. I was pleased with the hotel. I have paid more for much less elsewhere. Everything was spotless and the beds were comfortable although the pillow was skimpy. They give you two twin beds that you can push together if you ae a couple. The location was very good and gave me a real sense of what East Berlin was/is like. We could get to everything very easily. Some people have said there was no hot breakfast but we did have hot sausages and egggs a couple of mornings and anyway I know German breakfasts are not usually hot. If you don't want luxury, this is great. It's comfortable clean and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A true bargain in a great location”
Reviews.Author: luckystrike
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with six friends in November 2006, for a stag weekend in Berlin. The total cost per room per night was 97 euro (£66) for the triple room, and 78 euro (£54) for the double rooms, including breakfast. We found the hotel to be extremely good value, and I would recommend it to anyone looking for somewhere cheap, comfortable, clean and safe. The rooms were huge and the bathrooms were perfectly adequate, with one of the most powerful showers I have ever used. There was plenty of wardrobe space, and an electronic safe. There was also a TV with about 20 channels, a small kitchenette area and a fridge. Check in and check out were both hassle free, and the staff were pleasant and efficient. A good breakfast was available in the lobby from 7:00 – 10:00 and had a large selection of fruit, cereal and yogurt, as well as breads, meats and cheeses. There were no hot choices. The bar is part of the reception, and was therefore open 24 hours a day. German beer costs 2 euro (£1.40) per bottle. The location of the Agon is its big advantage. It’s only a 10 minute walk to Alexanderplatz, where there are lots of bars, restaurants and shops. Trams leave from the front door and it’s only a short journey to many of the other main districts of Berlin. Taxis from Tegel Airport to the hotel took 25 minutes and cost about 20 euro (£14). I also would like to mention the absolutely brilliant tour we did on the Saturday. It is called ‘The Original Insider Tour’ (the yellow tour) and had been recommended to us. Leaflets are available on the desk in the hotel’s reception. The company offer 8 different tours, most of them running daily, and including walking tours, bike tours, pub crawls. Our tour – called The Famous Walk – was completely on foot and left at 10:30am from Hackescher Markt, which is only 15 minutes walk from the hotel. In four and a half hours we saw all of Berlin’s main attractions including the spectacular boulevard of Unter den Linden, the Reichstag, Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, the Berlin Wall, the site of Hitler’s bunker, the memorial to the murdered Jews of Europe, Museum Island, and the two main cathedrals. There was a 30 minute break for lunch at a nice cafe. The tour was in English and there were about 40 people of all ages on it. It didn’t have to be booked in advance, and was a bargain at only 12 euro (£8). I would recommend it because Berlin is huge and to try and see all of the sights by yourself in one day would be almost impossible.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: revolution81
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Agon in July 2005. I booked twin room for 50 eur per night. Room was large and had balcony and small kitchenette and it was cleaned daily. Breakfast was excellent as well and was already included in the room price. I would definitely recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: steveandian
Reviews.Content: my partner and I have recently returned from a short break to berlin.We stayed for 3 nights at the agon a/platz hotel. This hotel is superb value for money with huge rooms . The staff were very friendly and helpful and all spoke good english. The breakfast was more than substantial with a wide choice including cereals ,fruit salad ,cold meats, cheese, eggs, sausages, and even salads which is very unusual for breakfast.. Our room was very clean with fresh bedlinen and ample towels and cleaned to a high standard each day. The location was very convenient with the tram stop just across the road from the hotel. The M4 and M6 run literally every few minutes into the centre of the city and takes only a couple minutes to get to Alexander platz main station with connecting U and S trains to all parts of the city, and a direct airport express train to schonefeld airport. All in all a very enjoyable stay and would recommend and use this hotel again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Maribel69
Reviews.Content: We were in Berlin spending Christmas time in 2005. We booked this hotel via internet (48 euros double room with breakfast) and we hadn't any problems with the reserve, even we checked in at 00:30 a.m.!! But the recepction staff were really very friendly, young people and very nice. The location is ideal, near Alexanderplatz, the central station, and very close to the most important monuments like Reichstag or the museums island. It's close too to Unter den Liden, where you can find a lot of restaurants & shops. Big room with kitchen, clean bathroom, decent breakfast.(not much variety) . Cool quality for cheap price.

Reviews.Title: “avoid if you like your sleep”
Reviews.Author: robdavid
Reviews.Content: A good budget price and an excellent location. Well maintained rooms. BUT Avoid if you dont like sharing your hotel with school groups. Stayed for two nights. On both nights had to share the hotel with touring school groups. Spend the night listening to pupils running up and down the corridors, knocking on all the hotel doors, dialing all the room extensions at three in the morning, having kissing session in the lift while riding up and down and not allowing anybody else into the lift, blaring music coming from not one room but four different rooms above and on either side. When reporting all this to the hotel staff, we were told that they are paying guests like ourselves and have every right to enjoy the hotel facilities (which apparently includes pupils climbing over hotel balconies trying to get access to our room.) Avoid at all costs if this is not your scene because we were informed that this particular hotel now specialises in school groups.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: PGB
Reviews.Content: About 10 minutes walk from Alexanderplatz or 3 minutes by M4 tram which stops almost at the hotel door. Alexanderplatz station connects directly with Schonenfeld Airport (S9 train) & is also good for underground lines when exploring the city. Spent 4 nights here. Rooms are huge & spotless. Each room has a kitchenette. Our double room was a suite and had a fridge The value for money is fantastic - and the rate includes an excellent cold buffet breakfast. Saw reference to unfriendly staff on earlier reviews - this was definitely not our experience. We arrived after 11 p.m. on the first day and were warmly greeted & efficiently registered. Even though we had booked a second room separately - and weeks later - for our daughter, they had allocated us neighbouring rooms. We would definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure Hotel Berlin am Alexanderplatz
HotelInfo.Address: Mollstrasse 4, 10178 Berlin, Germany
